summary: Imagine having an intimate moment with Sansa Stark and knowing it could never happen again.
title: Imagine having an intimate moment with Sansa Stark and knowing it could never happen again.
body:
You were the only person in Sansa’s bedrooms when she finished dressing herself. Since being back in Winterfell, she had evolved into her own style and insisted on doing more things herself, despite being a Lady. You were there to assist her with anything that she may need, but over time, you had turned from slave to companion to dearest friend.

Sansa gave you a small smile, one that stayed in her eyes after it had disappeared from her lips. It took your breath away. “Well?” She asked, standing with absolutely perfect posture.

“The black brings out the paleness of your skin, my lady, so it looks like snow. And that in turn makes your eyes look like ice. You are absolutely beautiful.” You bowed your head.

Sansa was still a girl in her late teens, but looked every part the woman. On occasion, she would show that teenage side, but only around you. She went to the mirror and did a turn in front of it, admiring herself. You got to your feet and helped to adjust the skirt so it would drape better on her front. “There,” You smiled.

“Thanks…. for everything, really.” Sansa wrapped her arms around you and laid her head on your shoulder. This sort of affection was rare between friends even, let alone Sansa who repelled most physical attention. But you took it and you kissed the side of her head before she retreated backwards.

It was a shame that it was unlikely ever to happen again, now that she was especially busy as Lady of Winterfell - and with the incoming war that Jon Snow spoke about. But regardless, when you did occasionally catch Sansa’s eye, you always saw a little spark, just for you.

body:
Never Shaken

White Harbour was still half a moon’s turn away and more when the first scout from the Manderlys found them. He was a boy no older than Sansa, on a sturdy-legged horse of Northern breeding, and his nose was eaten away by frostbite, but he stood firm against their bedraggled, bewildered band of warriors nonetheless.

Read chapter four @ AO3 | Buy me a coffee!

summary: Honestly, I’m rooting for the white walkers. I hope the reason for all this uproar is because Night King is cruising for a...
body:
Honestly, I’m rooting for the white walkers. I hope the reason for all this uproar is because Night King is cruising for a Queen, just as an ancient descendant of the first men (a Stark) fell in love with a white walker woman, becoming one of the first Night Kings.

He comes, cruising for a queen… Danerys tries to kill him with fire, Cersei straight up sucks, but low and behold hottie red-headed Stark, due north.

Meanwhile, Jon and Danny incest baby is left to rule the world of men, watched over by a snarky dwarf. Because Aunt and Nephew need to die. Sick of the lame-incest drama.

So in the end… Sansa Stark becomes the Night Queen, rules the far far north away from all the douche-bagery of men, and is never forced to be a baby maker or play the game of thrones because she’s already WON.

body:
game if thrones fanfiction recommendation

bookstores can’t save your life, but they can give you a better one by janie_tangerine

chapters: 1/1

“You’re blushing,” Bronn says, sounding way too amused for Tyrion’s liking. “Just gift her a decent book with your number written on the first page.”

“The hell? No way,” Tyrion cuts him off. “That’d be creepy. And I saw her twice. Is your mind in the gutter or what?”

“Says the one who has ten different porn and erotica recommendations depending on what kind of porn someone likes to read.”

“Well, I share if you ask for my very humble opinion only!”

“The soccer mom definitely didn’t want your humble opinion.”

“Just check if I can shelve that stuff already,” Tyrion groans, absolutely not thinking about Sansa Stark’s pretty sky-blue eyes and about her henthusiasm about bad romance books and about how she thought his shop matched the name.

Or: in which Tyrion owns a bookshop and might be harboring a crush on his latest returning customer.

body: It’s so weird to me when people tell me how much they hated Sansa in the beginning. I don’t get what about her was hate-worthy? She made some mistakes because she was a child who had trust in adults she didn’t know were bad people and she was a brat to her sister and father sometimes bc she was genuinely upset with them but that’s?? so minor?? compared to the other characters people hate in the book and show?

summary: “The Westermarck effect, or reverse sexual imprinting, is a hypothetical psychological effect through which people who live in...
body:
“The Westermarck effect, or reverse sexual imprinting, is a hypothetical psychological effect through which people who live in close domestic proximity during the first few years of their lives become desensitized to sexual attraction.”

Arya will be more forgiving… until she realises, with terror, that SHE HAS FALLEN IN LOVE WITH JON, WHO IS NOT ONLY HER HALF-BROTHER, but also a man of the Night’s Watch, sworn to celibacy. THEIR PASSION will continue to torment Jon and Arya throughout the trilogy, until the secret of Jon’s true parentage is finally revealed in the last book.

summary: I would hate for Sansa to be the Girl in Grey. How many times is she going to be fleeing bad situations? It's nearly the end of...
question: I would hate for Sansa to be the Girl in Grey. How many times is she going to be fleeing bad situations? It's nearly the end of the book series and she has a large and willing army willing to commit to her cause if she tells them she's Sansa Stark.
answer: I do understand this sentiment to a certain extent, but if it’s done well, it could be compelling for her character. The difference would be that all these other times, it was other people who helped her escape from one bad situation, or is was other people who decided where she was going to go, so if Sansa runs away on her own (while utilizing her intelligence and manipulation skills on the way) to go where SHE wants to go, I think it would work rather well. Of course, personally, the idea of her getting the vale and the north to her side through her growing skills as a player in the game sounds like an even better plot for her character next book.

summary: Slaying giants: Why Sansa may cause Tyrion’s downfall
title: Slaying giants: Why Sansa may cause Tyrion’s downfall
body:
I posted a version of this on Quora as an answer to the question “Do you hope Sansa is Tyrion’s downfall?” Perhaps, ‘hope’ is to harsh a word. That being said I’ve long theorized Sansa could very well be Tyrion’s downfall. With the recent ‘supposed’ leaks…(at this point I’m still skeptical about how valid they are)…the theory seems possible. **NOTE There are no spoilers in this post. This is something I wrote before the recent ‘leaks’***

Let’s get into it, shall we? There is a possibility that Littlefinger was a red herring for the ‘giant’ that Sansa slays in the Ghost of High Heart’s prophecy. The real giant could instead be Tyrion. There are clues in the book about this. Tyrion is referred to by Maester Aemon as a ‘Giant Come Among Us’. Jon comments on the size of Tyrion’s shadow as do others later in the series.

More over, Sansa’s marriage to Tyrion is an outstanding issue. She thinks about this in her Alayne chapter in TWoW. The show so far has brushed this aside. Sansa is a high born lady with a very important claim to the North. Not to mention that she was married in the Sept in front a lot of people. Simple non-consummation isn’t enough to end this marriage. She either needs an annulment or Tyrion’s gotta die.

 If Daenerys and Tyrion are smart they would push for this marriage to be acknowledged. show!Sansa has effectively become Jon’s heir. If he were to die in battle, Sansa gets the North. Tyrion claiming his marriage is valid gives him control over the North.

Sansa is not going to want this! Nor is Jon. She knows the risks. Another issue could arise once Jon’s parentage is revealed. She may decide she wants to marry someone else. Her marrying Jon would give him a lot of support if he did want to make a play for the crown. Tyrion could try and prevent this on Daenerys’ behalf by reasserting his marriage to Sansa. She can’t marry Jon if she’s already married.

OR as some have suggested, Tyrion may be in the process of betraying Dany and Jon by delivering Sansa to Cersei. Whether Cersei or Dany is Queen, as long as the marriage stands, Tyrion could attempt to get control of Winterfell. Cersei might be more likely to give him that. Dany under Jon’s influence may be pressured to not acknowledge the marriage.  

Sansa needs to get out of this marriage. It’s too dangerous for her and her family. She could get an annulment but only if the High Septon grants her one. And Jon follows the Old Gods as does Sansa (she follows both the Old Gods and the seven). Not to mention Jon is pretty close to a lot of Rhllorists (Stannis, Mel, etc.). High Septon isn’t going to have a very high incentive for granting her an annulment especially if he thinks she wants to marry Jon.

Again, Tyrion’s gotta go for Sansa to be truly free to make her own decisions. Tyrion could try to consummate their marriage and Sansa would slay him. She’s free. There are of course other ways she could slay him. For this post I took a look at the definition of a giant. It can be a someone of great physical OR intellectual strength. I tend to agree with the more literal interpretation of the prophecies happening albeit with a surprise or a twist. Meaning I prefer Sansa to physical slay Tyrion. It could be metaphorical and she could outwit Tyrion’s giant intellect. In Tyrion’s first show conversation with Jon on Dragonstone, he both mentions Sansa as his wife and her intelligence. 

There is one thing to note. book!Littlefinger could procure her annulment in order for her to marry Harry Hardying. I tend to think Littlefinger won’t get around to doing this before Sansa makes a run for it. Her not having an annulment keeps her under his control. She can’t run off and marry anyone else. So, he has little motivation to do this. Bringing us back to the original problem and solution, Sansa is still married. There are two ways to end it. One being Tyrion’s downfall.

Honestly, I really hope that show does something with this Sansa-Tyrion marriage. It’s an interesting political plot. It plays into Sansa’s agency. Plus, she’s had a role in the downfall of almost all her most serious suitors (Joffrey, Ramsey, Littlefinger…) Next up would be Tyrion.
body_abstract:
I posted a version of this on Quora as an answer to the question “Do you hope Sansa is Tyrion’s downfall?” Perhaps, ‘hope’ is to harsh a word. That being said I’ve long theorized Sansa could very well be Tyrion’s downfall. With the recent ‘supposed’ leaks…(at this point I’m still skeptical about how valid they are)…the theory seems possible. **NOTE There are no spoilers in this post. This is something I wrote before the recent ‘leaks’***

Let’s get into it, shall we? There is a possibility that Littlefinger was a red herring for the ‘giant’ that Sansa slays in the Ghost of High Heart’s prophecy. The real giant could instead be Tyrion. There are clues in the book about this. Tyrion is referred to by Maester Aemon as a ‘Giant Come Among Us’. Jon comments on the size of Tyrion’s shadow as do others later in the series.

More over, Sansa’s marriage to Tyrion is an outstanding issue. She thinks about this in her Alayne chapter in TWoW. The show so far has brushed this aside. Sansa is a high born lady with a very important claim to the North. Not to mention that she was married in the Sept in front a lot of people. Simple non-consummation isn’t enough to end this marriage. She either needs an annulment or Tyrion’s gotta die.

I posted a version of this on Quora as an answer to the question “Do you hope Sansa is Tyrion’s downfall?” Perhaps, ‘hope’ is to harsh a word. With the recent ‘supposed’ leaks…(at this point I’m still skeptical about how valid they are)…the theory seems possible. **NOTE There are no spoilers in this post. This is something I wrote before the recent ‘leaks’***

Let’s get into it, shall we? There is a possibility that Littlefinger was a red herring for the ‘giant’ that Sansa slays in the Ghost of High Heart’s prophecy. The real giant could instead be Tyrion. There are clues in the book about this. Tyrion is referred to by Maester Aemon as a ‘Giant Come Among Us’. Jon comments on the size of Tyrion’s shadow as do others later in the series.

More over, Sansa’s marriage to Tyrion is an outstanding issue. She thinks about this in her Alayne chapter in TWoW. The show so far has brushed this aside. Sansa is a high born lady with a very important claim to the North. Not to mention that she was married in the Sept in front a lot of people. Simple non-consummation isn’t enough to end this marriage. She either needs an annulment or Tyrion’s gotta die.

[[MORE]]

 If Daenerys and Tyrion are smart they would push for this marriage to be acknowledged. show!Sansa has effectively become Jon’s heir. If he were to die in battle, Sansa gets the North. Tyrion claiming his marriage is valid gives him control over the North.

Sansa is not going to want this! Nor is Jon. She knows the risks. Another issue could arise once Jon’s parentage is revealed. She may decide she wants to marry someone else. Her marrying Jon would give him a lot of support if he did want to make a play for the crown. Tyrion could try and prevent this on Daenerys’ behalf by reasserting his marriage to Sansa. She can’t marry Jon if she’s already married.

OR as some have suggested, Tyrion may be in the process of betraying Dany and Jon by delivering Sansa to Cersei. Whether Cersei or Dany is Queen, as long as the marriage stands, Tyrion could attempt to get control of Winterfell. Cersei might be more likely to give him that. Dany under Jon’s influence may be pressured to not acknowledge the marriage.  

Sansa needs to get out of this marriage. It’s too dangerous for her and her family. She could get an annulment but only if the High Septon grants her one. And Jon follows the Old Gods as does Sansa (she follows both the Old Gods and the seven). Not to mention Jon is pretty close to a lot of Rhllorists (Stannis, Mel, etc.). High Septon isn’t going to have a very high incentive for granting her an annulment especially if he thinks she wants to marry Jon.

Again, Tyrion’s gotta go for Sansa to be truly free to make her own decisions. Tyrion could try to consummate their marriage and Sansa would slay him. She’s free. There are of course other ways she could slay him. For this post I took a look at the definition of a giant. It can be a someone of great physical OR intellectual strength. I tend to agree with the more literal interpretation of the prophecies happening albeit with a surprise or a twist. Meaning I prefer Sansa to physical slay Tyrion. It could be metaphorical and she could outwit Tyrion’s giant intellect. In Tyrion’s first show conversation with Jon on Dragonstone, he both mentions Sansa as his wife and her intelligence. 

There is one thing to note. book!Littlefinger could procure her annulment in order for her to marry Harry Hardying. I tend to think Littlefinger won’t get around to doing this before Sansa makes a run for it. Her not having an annulment keeps her under his control. She can’t run off and marry anyone else. So, he has little motivation to do this. Bringing us back to the original problem and solution, Sansa is still married. There are two ways to end it. One being Tyrion’s downfall.

Honestly, I really hope that show does something with this Sansa-Tyrion marriage. It’s an interesting political plot. It plays into Sansa’s agency. Plus, she’s had a role in the downfall of almost all her most serious suitors (Joffrey, Ramsey, Littlefinger…) Next up would be Tyrion.

blog.name: silkygoldmilkweed
blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

title: Fidelity
body:
I can’t prove it but I think Sandor has been completely faithful in his UnMarriage to Sansa since he cloaked her in the Red Keep after Robb’s victory at Oxcross. 

Like the gods arranged the marriage but they only told the Hound it was happening, and there was no evidence whatsoever that he wasn’t completely just a hallucinating pathetic needy loser, but he keeps his “vows” anyway. 

No more whores, no more kitchen wenches, nothing, because he already had a wife. 


UnWedding
UnMarriage
UnKiss goodbye 

{goodbye wife, we can’t be together now, but I’m still yours and you’re still mine, in my heart}

tags: a song of ice and fire
body:
[Fan-fiction] GoT S8E6- The Final Sequence

The screen comes back to light after a couple of seconds of darkness. We see the Sun shining over the Red Keep and a welcome buzz around the city of King’s Landing

‘A few years later’, the screen says. 

The camera moves along a room inside the Red Keep and we hear a familiar voice.

“Come on Ned, I know you know this one. You only learned it last week,” Sam says.

Little Ned thinks for a second and then says, “Highgarden.”

“Very well lad! Now, which is next house on your list of the Great House of Westeros that are now extinct?”

Meanwhile, we see a silhouette of a man behind Ned. Youthful, dark hair and a muscular build. 

“Um, Lannister. Words- Hear me roar! Sigil- A Golden Lion on a field of crimson. The seat of power- Casterly Rock.”

We hear someone clapping in a distance. 

“Father!” Ned screams. 

We see Ned running into the arms of Jon as he embraces him. 

“You’re doing good. I think Grand Maester would agree that today’s class can be concluded now.”

Sam nods.

“Go on now. Your mother is looking for you,” Jon says to Ned who then runs out of the room.

“Aren’t your services required downstairs Grand Maester?” Jon asks.

“No, Your Grace,” Sam replies.

They laugh.

“Tell me, will he come to me in 10 years and tell me he wants to be a maester?” Jon asks.

“What? Rubbish! He is Jon Snow’s son. He won’t enjoy that life. Boredom isn’t in his blood.” They laugh again.

“How is she?” asks Sam.

“She is fine. Today wasn’t a part of her schemes when she was little but her handmaidens tell me that she likes her dress. But Gendry is baffled,” Jon laughs. 

“Is he? Doesn’t know where to put it? Didn’t you tell him where to put it?” Sam smiles.

“You’re talking about my sister. You know that, don’t you?”

“Apologies, Your Grace.” 

“Your Grace.” Jon sighs. “It’s been seven years, yet it hasn’t grown on me. Seems like yesterday we went north of the wall and took our vows. We swore to never own lands and take titles, to not take wives and have children. I’m pretty sure I’ve broken all of them,” Jon says. 

“Where were you? I was looking for you some hours ago,” Sam asks.

“The entire capital knows where I was. And you didn’t?”

“Ah! You were riding Drogon. The beast needed some fresh air. He had been in the Dragonspit for a month.” 

Jon walks towards a window in front of him and looks out.

“He reminds me of her. He is the only one who can. It’s been seven years since the war and sometimes I can’t even remember her face.” 

Sam looks sad and moves forward to comfort Jon. 

“Most of us were fighting for our lives. She was fighting for many lives. I know, it’s a pity. Life is not fair but life goes on. You know that better than most.”

“Aye! I guess I do.” Jon smiles a little, just to show Sam that he is okay.

“Will you ever tell Ned?” Sam says after a pause.

“Tell him what?” Jon asks.

“About his real mother. About Daenerys. You didn’t know about your real mother for a long time but it is a different situation for Ned. Unlike you, he won’t be killed by the King for it.” Sam says.

“What good will that do? And he has a mother just like I had a father. The only father I knew, and the only one I needed.”

“So you will let him think his entire life that his real mother is Sansa? She was his aunt but you made her his mother when you married her after the war.”

Silence.

“I married Sansa to unite the seven kingdoms. I am a Targaryen. And even though I was a Northman my entire life, the northern lords needed a better reason than that to give up their dream of independence and bend the knee to another Targaryen. I did it for the realm.” Jon says softly.

“Well, whatever happened is behind us. Today is a day of celebration. But I’m warning ya. If someday he finds out that his mother is not Sansa and that you decided to keep it from him, he won’t forgive you. Ned Stark is dead but would you have forgiven him had he lived?”

We see Ghost approaching from behind with Ser Davos who is wearing the badge of The Hand of the King- the first crabber’s son to wear the badge, as Stannis put it all those years ago. 

“It’s time, Your Grace. Lady Arya is waiting for you downstairs.”

“Good Luck,” Sam says as he leaves. 

“I’ve come too far from home Ser Davos,” Jon says after a few minutes.

“This your home now, Your Grace.”

“Doesn’t feel like home. I was never supposed to be here. I was never supposed to be King. I thought I would end my life on the wall, shivering for warmth. I have come way too far.”

“Well, you were supposed to be a bastard too. But suddenly you decided to become the true heir. You were supposed to be dead. But, you came back. Let’s face it, Jon, you’ve surprised life more than life has surprised you. Do you really think this is the biggest one?” Davos says.

“Where would you put it on your list?” Jon asks.

“Probably at the bottom, Your Grace,” Davos replies.

“Aye! The bottom seems about right.”

Ser Davos has a letter in his hand and he looks hesitant.

Finally, he begins, “There was a raven, Your Grace, from Winterfell, from Lord Stark.”

“Now that sounds like home. He still prefer being called Bran though.” He smiles a little. “What does it say?”

“He has had another vision,” Ser Davos looks concerned.

Ser Davos hands him the letter. Jon sits down. Ghost beside him tries to take a look.

“Winter is Coming,” Jon says and starts laughing along with Ser Davos.

The camera zooms out and the screen turns black, the Stark theme runs in the background.

“Aye! The bottom seems about right.”

Ser Davos has a letter in his hand and he looks hesitant.

Finally, he begins, “There was a raven, Your Grace, from Winterfell, from Lord Stark.”

“Now that sounds like home. He still prefer being called Bran though.” He smiles a little. “What does it say?”

“He has had another vision,” Ser Davos looks concerned.

Ser Davos hands him the letter. Jon sits down. Ghost beside him tries to take a look.

“Winter is Coming,” Jon says and starts laughing along with Ser Davos.

The camera zooms out and the screen turns black, the Stark theme runs in the background.

trail.content_raw:
[Fan-fiction] GoT S8E6- The Final Sequence

The screen comes back to light after a couple of seconds of darkness. We see the Sun shining over the Red Keep and a welcome buzz around the city of King’s Landing

‘A few years later’, the screen says. 

The camera moves along a room inside the Red Keep and we hear a familiar voice.

“Come on Ned, I know you know this one. You only learned it last week,” Sam says.

Little Ned thinks for a second and then says, “Highgarden.”

“Very well lad! Now, which is next house on your list of the Great House of Westeros that are now extinct?”

Meanwhile, we see a silhouette of a man behind Ned. Youthful, dark hair and a muscular build. 

“Um, Lannister. Words- Hear me roar! Sigil- A Golden Lion on a field of crimson. The seat of power- Casterly Rock.”

We hear someone clapping in a distance. 

“Father!” Ned screams. 

We see Ned running into the arms of Jon as he embraces him. 

“You’re doing good. I think Grand Maester would agree that today’s class can be concluded now.”

Sam nods.

“Go on now. Your mother is looking for you,” Jon says to Ned who then runs out of the room.

“Aren’t your services required downstairs Grand Maester?” Jon asks.

“No, Your Grace,” Sam replies.

They laugh.

“Tell me, will he come to me in 10 years and tell me he wants to be a maester?” Jon asks.

“What? Rubbish! He is Jon Snow’s son. He won’t enjoy that life. Boredom isn’t in his blood.” They laugh again.

“How is she?” asks Sam.

“She is fine. Today wasn’t a part of her schemes when she was little but her handmaidens tell me that she likes her dress. But Gendry is baffled,” Jon laughs. 

“Is he? Doesn’t know where to put it? Didn’t you tell him where to put it?” Sam smiles.

“You’re talking about my sister. You know that, don’t you?”

“Apologies, Your Grace.” 

“Your Grace.” Jon sighs. “It’s been seven years, yet it hasn’t grown on me. Seems like yesterday we went north of the wall and took our vows. We swore to never own lands and take titles, to not take wives and have children. I’m pretty sure I’ve broken all of them,” Jon says. 

“Where were you? I was looking for you some hours ago,” Sam asks.

“The entire capital knows where I was. And you didn’t?”

“Ah! You were riding Drogon. The beast needed some fresh air. He had been in the Dragonspit for a month.” 

Jon walks towards a window in front of him and looks out.

“He reminds me of her. He is the only one who can. It’s been seven years since the war and sometimes I can’t even remember her face.” 

Sam looks sad and moves forward to comfort Jon. 

“Most of us were fighting for our lives. She was fighting for many lives. I know, it’s a pity. Life is not fair but life goes on. You know that better than most.”

“Aye! I guess I do.” Jon smiles a little, just to show Sam that he is okay.

“Will you ever tell Ned?” Sam says after a pause.

“Tell him what?” Jon asks.

“About his real mother. About Daenerys. You didn’t know about your real mother for a long time but it is a different situation for Ned. Unlike you, he won’t be killed by the King for it.” Sam says.

“What good will that do? And he has a mother just like I had a father. The only father I knew, and the only one I needed.”

“So you will let him think his entire life that his real mother is Sansa? She was his aunt but you made her his mother when you married her after the war.”

Silence.

“I married Sansa to unite the seven kingdoms. I am a Targaryen. And even though I was a Northman my entire life, the northern lords needed a better reason than that to give up their dream of independence and bend the knee to another Targaryen. I did it for the realm.” Jon says softly.

“Well, whatever happened is behind us. Today is a day of celebration. But I’m warning ya. If someday he finds out that his mother is not Sansa and that you decided to keep it from him, he won’t forgive you. Ned Stark is dead but would you have forgiven him had he lived?”

We see Ghost approaching from behind with Ser Davos who is wearing the badge of The Hand of the King- the first crabber’s son to wear the badge, as Stannis put it all those years ago. 

“It’s time, Your Grace. Lady Arya is waiting for you downstairs.”

“Good Luck,” Sam says as he leaves. 

“I’ve come too far from home Ser Davos,” Jon says after a few minutes.

“This your home now, Your Grace.”

“Doesn’t feel like home. I was never supposed to be here. I was never supposed to be King. I thought I would end my life on the wall, shivering for warmth. I have come way too far.”

“Well, you were supposed to be a bastard too. But suddenly you decided to become the true heir. You were supposed to be dead. But, you came back. Let’s face it, Jon, you’ve surprised life more than life has surprised you. Do you really think this is the biggest one?” Davos says.

“Where would you put it on your list?” Jon asks.

“Probably at the bottom, Your Grace,” Davos replies.

“Aye! The bottom seems about right.”

Ser Davos has a letter in his hand and he looks hesitant.

Finally, he begins, “There was a raven, Your Grace, from Winterfell, from Lord Stark.”

“Now that sounds like home. He still prefer being called Bran though.” He smiles a little. “What does it say?”

“He has had another vision,” Ser Davos looks concerned.

Ser Davos hands him the letter. Jon sits down. Ghost beside him tries to take a look.

“Winter is Coming,” Jon says and starts laughing along with Ser Davos.

The camera zooms out and the screen turns black, the Stark theme runs in the background.

caption:
make me choose ♥ sansa stark or daenerys targaryen | asked by @aarrontveit

Sometimes she would close her eyes and dream of her, but it was never Jorah Mormont she dreamed of; her lover was always younger and more comely, though her face remained a shifting shadow.

blog.name: silkygoldmilkweed
blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: There are two stories about fire and blood in ASOIAF
body:
There are two stories about fire and blood in ASOIAF

* fire and blood —> House Targaryen, secret king, magical queen

* fire and blood —> passion, sex, family, burn scars and burning rage in the love story of Sansa and Sandor. Men whose hearts are fire, burning hearts, forging a sword in the heart of a woman, kissed by fire, wolf blood, blood of my blood, that’s all about the forbidden and yet all-consuming love between Sansa Stark and Sandor Clegane.

George is a good writer.
